Description: THE CURRENT PROJECT PROPOSAL FOCUSES ON PROVIDING EDUCATIONAL AND EMPLOYMENT SUPPORT TO MEMBERS OF THE STATELESS ROMA POPULATION LIVING IN CAMPS AROUND ROME, ITALY.

THE MAIN OBJECTIVE OF THIS PROJECT IS ENSURING MEANINGFUL ACCESS TO QUALITY CASE MANAGEMENT AND PSYCHOSOCIAL SUPPORT TO SURVIVORS AND OTHER PERSONS IN NEED OF SUCH ASSISTANCE, WITHIN THE OVERARCHING OUTREACH CLINIC MODEL.

THE JULIA TAFT FUND WILL BE USED BY COOPERATIVA ROMA SOLIDARIETA CARITAS ROMA TO PROVIDE CARE, INCLUDING EDUCATION AND VOCATIONAL TRAINING, TO TRANSSEXUAL AND TRANSGENDER VICTIMS OF TRAFFICKING AND SEXUAL EXPLOITATION IN ROME.
THE OBJECTIVE IS TO BUILD AND VALIDATE MODELS OF RECEPTION THAT FACILITATE THE NEEDS EXPRESSED DIRECTLY BY THE BENEFICIARIES, WHO ARE THE BEST EXPERTS OF THEIR PERSONAL HISTORY AND EXPERIENCE.

THE OBJECTIVE OF THIS PROJECT FOCUSES ON THE POST-ARRIVAL ACTIVITIES OF THE PERSONS ARRIVING IN ITALY THROUGH THE HUMANITARIAN CORRIDORS PROGRAM AND IS TO SUPPORT A GROUP OF 50 REFUGEES FROM CYPRUS AND GREECE BY WELCOMING THEM.
ENABLE LGBTQI+ PEOPLE ANYWHERE IN THE UK TO RECEIVE QUALITY SPECIALIST LEGAL INFORMATION ON THE ASYLUM PROCESS.
TO ESTABLISH COMPREHENSIVE LEGAL SUPPORT TO UKRAINIAN REFUGEES IN SWITZERLAND, BY TRAINING OF VOLUNTEERS, CAPACITY BUILDING AND EMPOWERMENT.
THE PROJECT ADDRESSES CRITICAL GAPS IN SPAIN'S RECEPTION PROGRAM BY ASSISTING UNACCOMPANIED REFUGEE OR MIGRANT CHILDREN WITH LEGAL ADVICE AND REPRESENTATION.
